events.title: Start of World War II
events.description: Germany invades Poland, marking the official beginning of World War II.
events.significance: This invasion triggered a global conflict that lasted six years and drastically changed the political landscape of the world.

events.title: Great Kanto Earthquake in Japan
events.description: A massive earthquake strikes the Kanto region of Japan, including Tokyo and Yokohama, causing widespread destruction and loss of life.
events.significance: One of the deadliest earthquakes in Japanese history, it led to significant rebuilding efforts and changes in disaster management.

events.title: Belgian Airline Sabena Crash
events.description: Sabena Flight 548 crashes near Brussels, killing all 73 people on board, including the entire U.S. figure skating team.
events.significance: The crash devastated the figure skating community and led to changes in aviation safety and sports team travel protocols.

events.title: Nixon Ends Selective Service Draft
events.description: U.S. President Richard Nixon signs legislation ending the military draft, transitioning to an all-volunteer armed force.
events.significance: Marked a major shift in U.S. military policy and affected the composition and recruitment of the armed forces.
